list_definition.definition: a guide who travels with, and looks after, parties of tourists

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a courier on a coach trip.

list_ex_of_english: I am advised that drug couriers can make £50 for one single trip.
Therefore, individual private couriers stride the land.
Couriers have not been used to distribute press releases.
I have a vision of special couriers touring the country, trying to deliver cash to people in remote rural areas, to ensure that they are not excluded from the system.
They are part of the growing number of couriers taking parcels, letters and messages from one business house to another.
Drugs couriers carry drugs not only for money; they do it because they are threatened and blackmailed.
Is it not the case that these couriers usually travel by night in a sleeper which is only available for one person?
I believe they are called couriers.
